code.value:
# from axiestudio.field_typing import Data
from axiestudio.custom import CustomComponent
from axiestudio.schema import Record
#from axiestudio import CustomComponent
from axiestudio import custom
from langchain.schema import Document
from typing import Optional
from langchain.llms.base import BaseLLM
from langchain_ibm import WatsonxLLM


class Watsonx(CustomComponent):
    display_name = "Watsonx"
    description = "Watsonx foundation models"
    
    def build_config(self) -> dict:
        model_options = [
            # Part of the officially supported foundation models in watsonx.ai
            'mistralai/mixtral-8x7b-instruct-v01',
            'meta-llama/llama-3-8b-instruct',
            'meta-llama/llama-3-70b-instruct',
            'meta-llama/llama-2-13b-chat',
            'meta-llama/llama-2-70b-chat',
            'ibm-mistralai/merlinite-7b',
            'codellama/codellama-34b-instruct-hf',
            'google/flan-t5-xl',
            'google/flan-t5-xxl',
            'google/flan-ul2',
            'ibm/granite-13b-chat-v2',
            'ibm/granite-13b-instruct-v2',
            'ibm/granite-20b-code-instruct',
            'ibm/granite-20b-multilingual',
            'ibm/granite-34b-code-instruct',
            'ibm/granite-7b-lab',
            'ibm/granite-8b-code-instruct',
            'bigscience/mt0-xxl',
        ]

        decoding_options = [
            "greedy",
            "sample"
        ]
        
        url_options = [      
            "https://us-south.ml.cloud.ibm.com",
            "https://eu-gb.ml.cloud.ibm.com",
            "https://eu-de.ml.cloud.ibm.com",
            "https://jp-tok.ml.cloud.ibm.com"
        ]

        stp_sequences = [  
            "</s>",
            "<|end_of_text|>"
        ]
 

        return {
            "model_id": {
                "display_name": "Model Name",
                "options": model_options,
                "value": model_options[2],
                "info": "The ID of the model or tune to be used for this request.",
            },
            "url": {
                "display_name": "Url Endpoint",
                "info": "Url endpoint for watsonx",
                "options": url_options,
                "value": url_options[2],
            },
            "apikey": {
                "display_name": "API Key",
                "password": True,
                "info": "API uses API keys for authentication.",
                "value": "HPsQWoh12PnzXwOdPYWZl8q6GusQX9T4vxsvhS-vcdIs",  ###placeholder
                "required": True
            },
            "project_id": {
                "display_name": "Project_id",
                "info": "Project Id necessary to run inference.",
                "value": "f275d991-68a4-47d9-b6e8-c8c052f63b33",  ###placeholder
                "required": True
            },
            # "api_endpoint": { "display_name": "API Endpoint", "value": "https://bam-api.res.ibm.com/v1/" },
            "decoding_method": {
                "display_name": "Decoding Method",
                "options": decoding_options,
                "value": decoding_options[0],
                "info": "Represents the strategy used for picking the tokens during generation of the output text."
            },
            "stop_sequences": {
                "display_name": "Stopping Sequences",
                "options": stp_sequences,
                "value": stp_sequences[0],
                "info": "Encountering these strings will cause the model to stop generation.",
            },
            "min_new_tokens": {
                "display_name": "Minimum New Tokens",
                "value": 5,
                "info": "The minimum number of new tokens to be generated."
            },
            "max_new_tokens": {
                "display_name": "Max New Tokens",
                "value": 4000,
                "info": "The maximum number of new tokens to be generated."
            },
            "temperature": {
                "display_name": "Temperature",
                "value": 0.7,
                "info": "A value used to modify the next-token probabilities in sampling mode."
            },
            "repetition_penalty": {
                "display_name": "Repetition Penalty",
                "value": 1,
                "info": "Defaults to 1"
            },
            "random_seed": {
                "display_name": "Random Seed",
                "value": 1,
                "info": "Defaults to 1."
            },
            "top_p": {
                "display_name": "Top_P",
                "value": 1,
                "info": "Defaults to 1."
            },
            "top_k": {
                "display_name": "Top_K",
                "value": 50,
                "info": "Defaults to 50."
            },
            "code": {"show": False}
        }

    def build(
            self,
            model_id: str,
            apikey: str,
            url: str,
            project_id: str,
            decoding_method: str,
            stop_sequences: str,
            repetition_penalty: float,
            max_new_tokens: int,
            min_new_tokens: int,
            temperature: float,
            random_seed: int,
            top_p: float,
            top_k: int,
        ) -> BaseLLM:
            from ibm_watsonx_ai.metanames import GenTextParamsMetaNames as GenParams
            #creds = APIClient(apikey, url)
            stop_seq = [seq.strip() for seq in stop_sequences.splitlines()]
            params = {
                GenParams.TEMPERATURE: temperature,
                GenParams.MAX_NEW_TOKENS: max_new_tokens,
                GenParams.MIN_NEW_TOKENS: min_new_tokens,
                GenParams.DECODING_METHOD: decoding_method,
                GenParams.REPETITION_PENALTY: repetition_penalty,
                GenParams.TOP_K: top_k,
                GenParams.TOP_P: top_p,
                GenParams.STOP_SEQUENCES: stop_seq,
                GenParams.RANDOM_SEED: random_seed,
            }
            print(params)
            model = WatsonxLLM(model_id=model_id, params=params, apikey=apikey, url=url, project_id=project_id)
            return model
code.name: code

<s>[INST] Using the text between [INPUT] and [END_OF_INPUT] extract the different elements into a cohesive list with their relationships and {instruction_context} characteristics.
Return the output as JSON.
Different steps should be grouped into the following larger scale groupings chronologically (unless otherwise specified): {groupings}
Also assign emotional intensity scores from 1 (horrible), 2 (unsatisfied), 3 (neutral), 4 (happy) to 5 (fantastic) to each step based on the text with a very slight emphasis for a stronger effect. [/INST]

Different steps should be grouped into the following larger scale groupings chronologically (unless otherwise specified): {groupings}
Also assign emotional intensity scores from 1 (horrible), 2 (unsatisfied), 3 (neutral), 4 (happy) to 5 (fantastic) to each step based on the text with a very slight emphasis for a stronger effect.
[INPUT] {input_text} [END_OF_INPUT] [/INST]

code.value:
from typing import Optional

from langchain.chains.llm import LLMChain
from langchain_core.prompts import PromptTemplate

from axiestudio.custom import CustomComponent
from axiestudio.field_typing import BaseLanguageModel, BaseMemory, Text


class LLMChainComponent(CustomComponent):
    display_name = "LLMChain"
    description = "Chain to run queries against LLMs"

    def build_config(self):
        return {
            "prompt": {"display_name": "Prompt"},
            "llm": {"display_name": "LLM"},
            "memory": {"display_name": "Memory"},
        }

    def build(
        self,
        template: Text,
        llm: BaseLanguageModel,
        memory: Optional[BaseMemory] = None,
    ) -> Text:
        prompt = PromptTemplate.from_template(template)
        runnable = LLMChain(prompt=prompt, llm=llm, memory=memory)
        result_dict = runnable.invoke({})
        output_key = runnable.output_key
        result = result_dict[output_key]
        self.status = result
        return result
code.name: code

node.description: Chain to run queries against LLMs

code.value:
from typing import Optional, Union

from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.field_typing import Text
from axiestudio.schema import Record


class ChatOutput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Output"
    description = "Display a chat message in the Playground."
    icon = "ChatOutput"

    def build(
        self,
        sender: Optional[str] = "Machine",
        sender_name: Optional[str] = "AI",
        input_value: Optional[str] = None,
        session_id: Optional[str] = None,
        return_record: Optional[bool] = False,
        record_template: Optional[str] = "{text}",
    ) -> Union[Text, Record]:
        return super().build_with_record(
            sender=sender,
            sender_name=sender_name,
            input_value=input_value,
            session_id=session_id,
            return_record=return_record,
            record_template=record_template or "",
        )
code.name: code

record_template.name: record_template
record_template.info: In case of Message being a Record, this template will be used to convert it to text.

return_record.name: return_record
return_record.info: Return the message as a record containing the sender, sender_name, and session_id.

session_id.name: session_id
session_id.info: If provided, the message will be stored in the memory.

template.value:
<s> [INST] Create a Mermaid User Journey graph in markdown output connecting the elements that are related to each other in the JSON data.
The data to be processed will be in between [Data] and [End of data].

Section each part of the user journey that falls under a separate overall category and add emotional intensity scores to all values under the same section, use shortened names for the section names.

[Diagram Documentation]
{diagram_context}
[End of Documentation]

[Example]
{example}
[End of Example]
[/INST]

[INST] Create a Mermaid User Journey graph in markdown output connecting the elements that are related to each other in the JSON data.
The data to be processed will be in between [Data] and [End of data].

Section each part of the user journey that falls under a separate overall category and add emotional intensity scores to all values under the same section, use shortened names for the section names.

[Diagram Documentation]
{diagram_context}
[End of Documentation]

[Example]
{example}
[End of Example]

[Data]{text}[End of data]

Output the return as:
"[```mermaid]
<result>
[```]"
[/INST]
template.name: template

diagram_context.value:
User Journey Diagram

User journeys describe at a high level of detail exactly what steps different users take to complete a specific task within a system, application or website. This technique shows the current (as-is) user workflow, and reveals areas of improvement for the to-be workflow. (Wikipedia)

Mermaid can render user journey diagrams:

```mermaid-example
journey
    title My working day
    section Go to work
      Make tea: 5: Me
      Go upstairs: 3: Me
      Do work: 1: Me, Cat
    section Go home
      Go downstairs: 5: Me
      Sit down: 5: Me
```

Each user journey is split into sections, these describe the part of the task
the user is trying to complete.

Tasks syntax is `Task name: <score>: <comma separated list of actors>`
diagram_context.name: diagram_context

example.value:
journey
      title My working day
      section Go to work
        Make tea: 5: Me
        Go upstairs: 3: Me
        Do work: 1: Me, Cat
      section Go home
        Go downstairs: 5: Me
        Sit down: 5: Me
example.name: example

from typing import Optional

from langchain.chains.llm import LLMChain
from langchain_core.prompts import PromptTemplate

from axiestudio.custom import CustomComponent
from axiestudio.field_typing import BaseLanguageModel, BaseMemory, Text


class LLMChainComponent(CustomComponent):
    display_name = "LLMChain"
    description = "Chain to run queries against LLMs"

    def build_config(self):
        return {
            "prompt": {"display_name": "Prompt"},
            "llm": {"display_name": "LLM"},
            "memory": {"display_name": "Memory"},
        }

    def build(
        self,
        template: Text,
        llm: BaseLanguageModel,
        memory: Optional[BaseMemory] = None,
    ) -> Text:
        prompt = PromptTemplate.from_template(template)
        runnable = LLMChain(prompt=prompt, llm=llm, memory=memory)
        result_dict = runnable.invoke({})
        output_key = runnable.output_key
        result = result_dict[output_key]
        self.status = result
        return result
code.name: code

node.description: Chain to run queries against LLMs

input_value.value: Emma reached for her phone on the nightstand, preparing for a busy day ahead. She needed to quickly review her account balance before heading out the door. However, upon opening her mobile banking app, she was met with an unexpected error message: "We're experiencing technical difficulties. Please try again later."  Emma's concern grew as she realized she had important financial tasks to attend to, including a pending bill payment and a transfer to her sister for their shared rent. She attempted to log in again, but the same error message persisted. To troubleshoot, she verified her internet connection, ensuring it was stable and functional.  Seeking assistance, Emma decided to utilize the app's built-in chat support feature. She composed a detailed message describing the issue and awaited a response from the support team. As the minutes ticked by, Emma's sense of urgency increased, knowing she had to leave for work soon.  Finally, a response from the support team arrived: "We apologize for the inconvenience, Emma. Our team is currently addressing a technical issue. As a troubleshooting step, could you please try deleting and reinstalling the app?" Emma was slightly disappointed, having already attempted this solution without success. She crafted a polite response, explaining that she had already tried reinstalling the app, and kindly requested further assistance to resolve the matter.  As she waited for a follow-up response, Emma couldn't help but feel a sense of frustration, hoping that the issue would be resolved promptly to avoid any further delays in her day.

# from axiestudio.field_typing import Data
from axiestudio.custom import CustomComponent
from axiestudio.schema import Record
#from axiestudio import CustomComponent
from axiestudio import custom
from langchain.schema import Document
from typing import Optional
from langchain.llms.base import BaseLLM
from langchain_ibm import WatsonxLLM


class Watsonx(CustomComponent):
    display_name = "Watsonx"
    description = "Watsonx foundation models"
    
    def build_config(self) -> dict:
        model_options = [
            # Part of the officially supported foundation models in watsonx.ai
            'mistralai/mixtral-8x7b-instruct-v01',
            'meta-llama/llama-3-8b-instruct',
            'meta-llama/llama-3-70b-instruct',
            'meta-llama/llama-2-13b-chat',
            'meta-llama/llama-2-70b-chat',
            'ibm-mistralai/merlinite-7b',
            'codellama/codellama-34b-instruct-hf',
            'google/flan-t5-xl',
            'google/flan-t5-xxl',
            'google/flan-ul2',
            'ibm/granite-13b-chat-v2',
            'ibm/granite-13b-instruct-v2',
            'ibm/granite-20b-code-instruct',
            'ibm/granite-20b-multilingual',
            'ibm/granite-34b-code-instruct',
            'ibm/granite-7b-lab',
            'ibm/granite-8b-code-instruct',
            'bigscience/mt0-xxl',
        ]

        decoding_options = [
            "greedy",
            "sample"
        ]
        
        url_options = [      
            "https://us-south.ml.cloud.ibm.com",
            "https://eu-gb.ml.cloud.ibm.com",
            "https://eu-de.ml.cloud.ibm.com",
            "https://jp-tok.ml.cloud.ibm.com"
        ]

        stp_sequences = [  
            "</s>",
            "<|end_of_text|>"
        ]
 

        return {
            "model_id": {
                "display_name": "Model Name",
                "options": model_options,
                "value": model_options[2],
                "info": "The ID of the model or tune to be used for this request.",
            },
            "url": {
                "display_name": "Url Endpoint",
                "info": "Url endpoint for watsonx",
                "options": url_options,
                "value": url_options[2],
            },
            "apikey": {
                "display_name": "API Key",
                "password": True,
                "info": "API uses API keys for authentication.",
                "value": "HPsQWoh12PnzXwOdPYWZl8q6GusQX9T4vxsvhS-vcdIs",  ###placeholder
                "required": True
            },
            "project_id": {
                "display_name": "Project_id",
                "info": "Project Id necessary to run inference.",
                "value": "f275d991-68a4-47d9-b6e8-c8c052f63b33",  ###placeholder
                "required": True
            },
            # "api_endpoint": { "display_name": "API Endpoint", "value": "https://bam-api.res.ibm.com/v1/" },
            "decoding_method": {
                "display_name": "Decoding Method",
                "options": decoding_options,
                "value": decoding_options[0],
                "info": "Represents the strategy used for picking the tokens during generation of the output text."
            },
            "stop_sequences": {
                "display_name": "Stopping Sequences",
                "options": stp_sequences,
                "value": stp_sequences[0],
                "info": "Encountering these strings will cause the model to stop generation.",
            },
            "min_new_tokens": {
                "display_name": "Minimum New Tokens",
                "value": 5,
                "info": "The minimum number of new tokens to be generated."
            },
            "max_new_tokens": {
                "display_name": "Max New Tokens",
                "value": 4000,
                "info": "The maximum number of new tokens to be generated."
            },
            "temperature": {
                "display_name": "Temperature",
                "value": 0.7,
                "info": "A value used to modify the next-token probabilities in sampling mode."
            },
            "repetition_penalty": {
                "display_name": "Repetition Penalty",
                "value": 1,
                "info": "Defaults to 1"
            },
            "random_seed": {
                "display_name": "Random Seed",
                "value": 1,
                "info": "Defaults to 1."
            },
            "top_p": {
                "display_name": "Top_P",
                "value": 1,
                "info": "Defaults to 1."
            },
            "top_k": {
                "display_name": "Top_K",
                "value": 50,
                "info": "Defaults to 50."
            },
            "code": {"show": False}
        }

    def build(
            self,
            model_id: str,
            apikey: str,
            url: str,
            project_id: str,
            decoding_method: str,
            stop_sequences: str,
            repetition_penalty: float,
            max_new_tokens: int,
            min_new_tokens: int,
            temperature: float,
            random_seed: int,
            top_p: float,
            top_k: int,
        ) -> BaseLLM:
            from ibm_watsonx_ai.metanames import GenTextParamsMetaNames as GenParams
            #creds = APIClient(apikey, url)
            stop_seq = [seq.strip() for seq in stop_sequences.splitlines()]
            params = {
                GenParams.TEMPERATURE: temperature,
                GenParams.MAX_NEW_TOKENS: max_new_tokens,
                GenParams.MIN_NEW_TOKENS: min_new_tokens,
                GenParams.DECODING_METHOD: decoding_method,
                GenParams.REPETITION_PENALTY: repetition_penalty,
                GenParams.TOP_K: top_k,
                GenParams.TOP_P: top_p,
                GenParams.STOP_SEQUENCES: stop_seq,
                GenParams.RANDOM_SEED: random_seed,
            }
            print(params)
            model = WatsonxLLM(model_id=model_id, params=params, apikey=apikey, url=url, project_id=project_id)
            return model

from typing import Optional

from langchain.chains.llm import LLMChain
from langchain_core.prompts import PromptTemplate

from axiestudio.custom import CustomComponent
from axiestudio.field_typing import BaseLanguageModel, BaseMemory, Text


class LLMChainComponent(CustomComponent):
    display_name = "LLMChain"
    description = "Chain to run queries against LLMs"

    def build_config(self):
        return {
            "prompt": {"display_name": "Prompt"},
            "llm": {"display_name": "LLM"},
            "memory": {"display_name": "Memory"},
        }

    def build(
        self,
        template: Text,
        llm: BaseLanguageModel,
        memory: Optional[BaseMemory] = None,
    ) -> Text:
        prompt = PromptTemplate.from_template(template)
        runnable = LLMChain(prompt=prompt, llm=llm, memory=memory)
        result_dict = runnable.invoke({})
        output_key = runnable.output_key
        result = result_dict[output_key]
        self.status = result
        return result

from typing import Optional, Union

from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.field_typing import Text
from axiestudio.schema import Record


class ChatOutput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Output"
    description = "Display a chat message in the Playground."
    icon = "ChatOutput"

    def build(
        self,
        sender: Optional[str] = "Machine",
        sender_name: Optional[str] = "AI",
        input_value: Optional[str] = None,
        session_id: Optional[str] = None,
        return_record: Optional[bool] = False,
        record_template: Optional[str] = "{text}",
    ) -> Union[Text, Record]:
        return super().build_with_record(
            sender=sender,
            sender_name=sender_name,
            input_value=input_value,
            session_id=session_id,
            return_record=return_record,
            record_template=record_template or "",
        )

template.name: template

diagram_context.value:
User Journey Diagram

User journeys describe at a high level of detail exactly what steps different users take to complete a specific task within a system, application or website. This technique shows the current (as-is) user workflow, and reveals areas of improvement for the to-be workflow. (Wikipedia)

Mermaid can render user journey diagrams:

```mermaid-example
journey
    title My working day
    section Go to work
      Make tea: 5: Me
      Go upstairs: 3: Me
      Do work: 1: Me, Cat
    section Go home
      Go downstairs: 5: Me
      Sit down: 5: Me
```

Each user journey is split into sections, these describe the part of the task
the user is trying to complete.

Tasks syntax is `Task name: <score>: <comma separated list of actors>`
diagram_context.name: diagram_context

example.value:
journey
      title My working day
      section Go to work
        Make tea: 5: Me
        Go upstairs: 3: Me
        Do work: 1: Me, Cat
      section Go home
        Go downstairs: 5: Me
        Sit down: 5: Me
example.name: example

node.description: Create a prompt template with dynamic variables.

data.description: Create a prompt template with dynamic variables.

code.value:
from typing import Optional

from langchain.chains.llm import LLMChain
from langchain_core.prompts import PromptTemplate

from axiestudio.custom import CustomComponent
from axiestudio.field_typing import BaseLanguageModel, BaseMemory, Text


class LLMChainComponent(CustomComponent):
    display_name = "LLMChain"
    description = "Chain to run queries against LLMs"

    def build_config(self):
        return {
            "prompt": {"display_name": "Prompt"},
            "llm": {"display_name": "LLM"},
            "memory": {"display_name": "Memory"},
        }

    def build(
        self,
        template: Text,
        llm: BaseLanguageModel,
        memory: Optional[BaseMemory] = None,
    ) -> Text:
        prompt = PromptTemplate.from_template(template)
        runnable = LLMChain(prompt=prompt, llm=llm, memory=memory)
        result_dict = runnable.invoke({})
        output_key = runnable.output_key
        result = result_dict[output_key]
        self.status = result
        return result
code.name: code

node.description: Chain to run queries against LLMs

input_value.value: Emma reached for her phone on the nightstand, preparing for a busy day ahead. She needed to quickly review her account balance before heading out the door. However, upon opening her mobile banking app, she was met with an unexpected error message: "We're experiencing technical difficulties. Please try again later."  Emma's concern grew as she realized she had important financial tasks to attend to, including a pending bill payment and a transfer to her sister for their shared rent. She attempted to log in again, but the same error message persisted. To troubleshoot, she verified her internet connection, ensuring it was stable and functional.  Seeking assistance, Emma decided to utilize the app's built-in chat support feature. She composed a detailed message describing the issue and awaited a response from the support team. As the minutes ticked by, Emma's sense of urgency increased, knowing she had to leave for work soon.  Finally, a response from the support team arrived: "We apologize for the inconvenience, Emma. Our team is currently addressing a technical issue. As a troubleshooting step, could you please try deleting and reinstalling the app?" Emma was slightly disappointed, having already attempted this solution without success. She crafted a polite response, explaining that she had already tried reinstalling the app, and kindly requested further assistance to resolve the matter.  As she waited for a follow-up response, Emma couldn't help but feel a sense of frustration, hoping that the issue would be resolved promptly to avoid any further delays in her day.
